what: 7. Late Toxicity and Morbidity (only followup assessments)
title: EMBRACE-II Variable Description
text: Maximum grade specific toxicity morbidity across follow-time points Calculation: Maximum CTCAE grade value observed specific toxicity across follow-assessments Implementation: get_max_side_effects() Values: 0-5 (CTCAE grade scale) max_value_bladder_cystitis max_value_vagina_stenosis max_value_fistula max_value_gastro_proctitis Follow-timepoint maximum grade toxicity observed Calculation: Time point (e.g., “3m” 3 months) maximum CTCAE grade observed specific toxicity Implementation: get_max_side_effects() Values: Time point indicators (e.g., “3m”, “6m”, “12m”, etc.) max_timepoint_bladder_cystitis max_timepoint_vagina_stenosis max_timepoint_fistula max_timepoint_gastro_proctitis Overall maximum morbidity grade across toxicity endpoints time points Calculation: maximum value across max_value_* variables patient Implementation: emii_add_max_morbidity() Values: 0-5 (CTCAE grade scale) Purpose: Represents highest toxicity experienced patient regardless specific type timepoint toxicity morbidity data include various organ systems toxicity types: Bladder toxicity: Cystitis, frequency, incontinence, urgency, stenosis/stricture, bleeding Gastrointestinal toxicity: Abdominal pain/cramping, constipation, diarrhea, incontinence, proctitis, bleeding (different sites), stenosis/stricture Vaginal toxicity: Bleeding, discharge, dryness, mucositis, stenosis Fistula: Grading localization (bladder, rectum, vagina, etc.) Lymphatic complications: Edema (limb, trunk/genital), lymphocele, thromboembolic events Muscle/skeletal toxicity: Fibrosis, fracture, back/pelvic pain toxicities: Fatigue, hot flashes, insomnia, patient-specific issues

text: function calculates overall treatment time (OTT) days dataset containing EBRT start end dates, fraction dates. OTT computed EBRT start date last available treatment date, considering `ebrt_end_date_tdvh` fraction date columns.

title: Add Overall Treatment Time (OTT) to a Data Frame — emii_add_ott
Add Overall Treatment Time (OTT) to a Data Frame — emii_add_ott
text: data data frame containing treatment data. Must include `ebrt_start_date_tdvh`, `ebrt_end_date_tdvh`, columns representing fraction dates names containing "fraction" "date".

title: Add Overall Treatment Time (OTT) to a Data Frame — emii_add_ott
text: data frame two additional columns: `last_treatment_date`: latest treatment date row. `ott_days`: overall treatment time days (numeric).

title: Add Overall Treatment Time (OTT) to a Data Frame — emii_add_ott
code: library(dplyr) library(lubridate) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘lubridate’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     date, intersect, setdiff, union emii <- tibble(   embrace_id = c("AAR2001", "VIE2001"),   ebrt_start_date_tdvh = as.POSIXct(c("2016-11-04", "2016-03-30")),   ebrt_end_date_tdvh = as.POSIXct(c("2016-12-08", "2016-05-03")),   fraction01date_tdvh = as.POSIXct(c("2016-12-19", "2016-05-10")),   fraction02date_tdvh = as.POSIXct(c("2016-12-27", "2016-05-11")) ) emii_add_ott(emii) #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   embrace_id ebrt_start_date_tdvh ebrt_end_date_tdvh  fraction01date_tdvh #>   <chr>      <dttm>               <dttm>              <dttm>              #> 1 AAR2001    2016-11-04 00:00:00  2016-12-08 00:00:00 2016-12-19 00:00:00 #> 2 VIE2001    2016-03-30 00:00:00  2016-05-03 00:00:00 2016-05-10 00:00:00 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: fraction02date_tdvh <dttm>, last_treatment_date <dttm>, #> #   ott <dbl>
